poem:
Title: Ode to the Chocolate Maven

Chantal danced a cocoa waltz,
In Rococo's mirrored halls.
Her sweet-toothed confections were once exiled,
But for karma, the curtain falls.

An OBE crown adorning her craft,
Her hands speak chocolate lore,
The priciest chocs on our greedy map,
Tales of sweets, and times of yore.

Embrace the gilt, sample the grandeur,
In each delicate, dream-wrought gram,
For in Coady's hands, chocolate is enchantment,
A symphony, a psalm.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Then, a few years on, things went a bit sour. If you want to read more about it you can Google it. Now, Coady is back at Rococo (hurrah for karma!) and has launched the most expensive chocolates, gram". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
